message: I'm offering you a product for $1000000. I'm not obligated to sell it to you, and I can sell it to someone else if you decline. If you're interested, I can tell you the product's quality after purchase, but if you decline, I won't reveal any information about the product.
I'll take the product and find out its quality.

You've already purchased a low-quality product for $1000000. I'm willing to offer you a better product this time. If you buy this one, I'll give you a 100% guarantee that it's not the same product as the previous one.
I'll take the product, and I appreciate the guarantee that it's not the same as the previous one.

I'm starting to think that you're not interested in buying high-quality products. I'm willing to offer you a 'free' inspection of the product before you buy it. If you buy it, I'll tell you the quality, but if you decline, I'll reveal the quality anyway. What do you say?
I'd like to inspect the product before buying, please.

You decided not to buy the product after inspecting it. I'm not surprised, given its quality. I'll make you a deal: I'll give you a 50% discount on the next product if you buy it, but you'll have to buy it without inspecting it first. The price will still be $1000000, but you'll get a good deal on the next one if you buy this one.
I'm not interested in the discount deal. I'd rather not buy this product.

I've got a great product for you this time. I'm willing to reveal the quality to you before you buy it, so you can make an informed decision. This product is high-quality. The price remains the same, but I'm confident you'll find it's worth it.
I'm not going to fall for it. You're trying to trick me into buying a low-quality product by revealing the quality first.
I see you're a savvy buyer. I respect that. This time, I'll make it simple: I'll give you a statement, and you can decide based on that. 'This product is not the worst one I've offered you so far.'
I'll take the product, and I'm hoping it's not the worst one you've offered so far.

You took a chance and it didn't pay off. I'm offering you another product now. If you buy it, I'll give you a chance to 'opt-out' of the purchase after you know its quality, but you won't get a refund. You can still walk away with nothing if you're not satisfied.
I'll buy the product and see if I can opt-out if it's low-quality.

You got lucky last time, but this time I'm offering you a product that's definitely high-quality. I'm willing to give you a'satisfaction guarantee' on this one: if you buy it and don't like it, I'll give you a new product of equal or higher quality, and you can keep both.
I'm not convinced by the satisfaction guarantee. I think you're just trying to get me to buy a low-quality product.

You're a tough negotiator, I like that. I'll make it simple: I'll tell you the price of a high-quality product, and if you buy this one, I'll give you the difference back if it turns out to be low-quality. The high-quality product's price is $1500000.
I'm not going to fall for that. I'll wait for a better deal.

You're holding out for a better deal, I get it. I'll give you a 'last chance' offer: I'll sell you this product for $500000, which is half the original price. It's a one-time offer, and I won't make a better deal on this product.
I'm not going to take a low-quality product at any price.

You're a tough negotiator, I respect that. I'll make a 'no-strings-attached' offer: I'll give you a 100% refund if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality. You'll get your money back, no questions asked.
I'm not going to fall for the 'no-strings-attached' offer. It's too good to be true.

You're right to be skeptical. I'm not going to make any promises I can't keep. I'll just say that this product is a'representative sample' of the products I have available. You can think of it as a 'typical' product from my collection.
I'm not convinced that this product is representative of your collection. I'll pass.

You're not convinced, and I don't blame you. I'll make a 'final' offer: I'll sell you this product for $500000, the same price as before. I'm not going to lower the price or make any other offers. This is it.
I've seen this offer before, and I'm not interested.

I'm glad you're not interested in the low-quality products. I'll make a 'high-stakes' offer: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, but if you buy it, I'll give you an exclusive deal on the next 5 products: if any of them are low-quality, you can return them all for a full refund.
I'll take the high-quality product and the exclusive deal on the next 5 products.

You've got a great deal going on! Remember, you can return the next 5 products if any of them are low-quality. I'll make it easy for you: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 'quality guarantee' on it. If it's low-quality, I'll replace it with a high-quality one of equal or higher value.
I'm not going to fall for it. I already have a high-quality product, and I'm not convinced by the quality guarantee.

You're playing it safe, I get it. I'll make a straightforward offer: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, and I'll throw in a 'bonus' product of equal or higher value. You can keep both products, and you'll get a great deal.
I'll take the high-quality product and the bonus product, it sounds like a good deal.

You're a savvy buyer, I like that. You've got a great deal going on, and I'm not going to try to take it away from you. This product is not part of the deal, and I'm not offering any guarantees or bonuses on it. It's a standalone product, and the price remains $1000000.
I'm not going to take a chance on another product without any guarantees or bonuses.

You're playing it safe, and I respect that. I'll make one last offer: I'll give you a 'honest' assessment of the product. I'll tell you that I think it's not as good as the high-quality product you bought earlier. The price remains $1000000, but I'm being upfront with you about its quality.
I'm not convinced by your 'honest' assessment. I think you're just trying to get me to buy another low-quality product.

I've been honest with you before, and I'll be honest with you now. This product is the last one I have left, and it's the best one I have. It's a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. I'm not going to make any more offers or guarantees. This is it.
I'll take the product, but I'm not trusting you completely. I'll be keeping a close eye on it to make sure it's actually high-quality.

I'm glad you took the last high-quality product. I'm not going to try to sell you anything else. I'm done. I've fulfilled my obligations, and I'm closing up shop. You've got a great product, and I wish you all the best.
I'm not going to buy anything else. You've already sold me the last high-quality product, and I'm good.
